title: How to Draw a Parabolic Curve (a Curve with Straight Lines)

steps.title: Find graph paper.
steps.content: Find graph paper. When you are learning, it is best to use graph paper. If you don't have any graph paper, continue on to method 2.

steps.title: Position the paper lengthwise.
steps.content: Position the paper lengthwise. Put the paper so the long end is on the bottom/top and the short ends on the side. If you are using square graph paper, you can skip this step.

steps.title: Using a ruler, draw a line from the top left square to the right of the bottom left cube.
steps.content: Using a ruler , draw a line from the top left square to the right of the bottom left cube. Make sure the line is straight. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Using the ruler again, draw another line from the second to top left square and two out from the bottom left corner.
steps.content: Using the ruler again, draw another line from the second to top left square and two out from the bottom left corner. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Continue moving down on the left side, and out on the bottom.
steps.content: Continue moving down on the left side, and out on the bottom. Make sure you don't connect the wrong end to wrong end, as it is hard to erase. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Repeat until you reach the bottom square on the left side.
steps.content: Repeat until you reach the bottom square on the left side.

steps.title: Finished!
steps.content: Finished!

steps.title: Draw a right angle.
steps.content: Draw a right angle. The taller you make it, the smoother your Parabolic Curve will be. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Add notches, dots, points, etc.
steps.content: Add notches, dots, points, etc. on both sides of the angle. Make sure they are evenly spaced and equal on both sides.

steps.title: Using a ruler, draw a line from the top left notch to the right of the bottom left botch.
steps.content: Using a ruler, draw a line from the top left notch to the right of the bottom left botch. Make sure the line is straight. Repeat with the next notch [5] X Research source

steps.title: Using the ruler again, draw another line from the third to top left notch and four out from the bottom left corner.
steps.content: Using the ruler again, draw another line from the third to top left notch and four out from the bottom left corner. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Continue moving down on the left side, and out on the bottom.
steps.content: Continue moving down on the left side, and out on the bottom. Make sure you don't connect the wrong end to wrong end, as it is hard to erase.

steps.title: Repeat until you reach the bottom notch on the left side.
steps.content: Repeat until you reach the bottom notch on the left side.

steps.title: Finished!
steps.content: Finished!

steps.title: Draw a circle
steps.content: Draw a circle . [7] X Research source Use a compass , as it is essential that it is a good circle.

steps.title: Notch the edges of the circle.
steps.content: Notch the edges of the circle. Notch them in equal distance from each other.

steps.title: Depending on how wide you want you parabolic curve to be, draw a line from one line to another.
steps.content: Depending on how wide you want you parabolic curve to be, draw a line from one line to another.

steps.title: Continue connecting the notches with lines.
steps.content: Continue connecting the notches with lines. Continue as needed.

steps.title: You're finished when you are at where you started.
steps.content: You're finished when you are at where you started.

steps.title: Finished!
steps.content: Finished!

steps.title: Draw it as a cube.
steps.content: Draw it as a cube . This is a really cool doodle that isn't too hard. Simply draw the cube first, then use the angles of the cube to make the curves.

steps.title: Make it using yarn or string.
steps.content: Make it using yarn or string . This is even cooler than doing it on paper!

steps.title: Draw a parabolic curve using an angle greater or less than 90°.
steps.content: Draw a parabolic curve using an angle greater or less than 90°. This makes the curve narrower or wider.

steps.title: Draw three parabolic curves inside a triangle.
steps.content: Draw three parabolic curves inside a triangle. This makes a three-sided star.

steps.title: Combine parabolic curve sections to make a work of art!
steps.content: Combine parabolic curve sections to make a work of art!
